title: How to File an FIR or Police Complaint
problem_summary: If a crime has occurred, you can file a First Information Report (FIR) or a police complaint at a police station or through online portals.
who_can_use: Any person who has knowledge of a cognizable offence

step_by_step_procedure.description: Visit the nearest police station or access the state police online FIR portal.
Clearly explain the incident to the police officer, including date, time, place, and persons involved.
Provide a written complaint or dictate the complaint to the police officer.
Ensure the police records the information correctly and registers the FIR if the offence is cognizable.
Collect a copy of the FIR with the FIR number for future reference.

time_limits: As soon as possible after the incident

escalation_path.action: Approach Superintendent of Police or file complaint before Magistrate

tips_and_warnings: Always collect a copy of the FIR
Ensure details are accurate before signing
disclaimer: This is general legal information and not legal advice.
